title: What are things you believe to be absolutely true about this world? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s round, NOT flat!It’s in trouble from dirty humans not cleaning up after themselvesIt’s a finite resource: we can’t just scoop it out like a magically renewable container of ice creamShort of a revolutionary change in the laws of physics, it’s the only place we know OF or can get TO that’s suitable for us to live, so we’d better start doing a better job of getting along, and start taking points “2 & 3” above seriously. Otherwise, some 50–200 million years from now, archaeologists or interstellar explorers will be debating exactly how we went extinct.

That it has mass. That it acts as an anchor for its only close neighbor, the moon. It possesses an atmosphere. It is the third planet from the sun in a planetary system consisting of seven other planets, and one newly titled ‘minor’ planet, Pluto. The earth is the only planet we know of - so far - that inhabits life; its physical characteristics also make it the most unique planet so far discovered, both within our solar system as well as the hundreds of others discovered beyond it. I also believe it’s a fragile place, and . . like anything fragile? it will take only so much abuse before experiencing catastrophic failure. Lastly? I believe we need to respect the earth as much as most Americans, who own cars or homes, respect them as well.
